info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 3:29PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions southeastern Missoula and north central Ravalli Counties through 430 PM MST... At 326 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of intense snow showers that will be impacting the interstate 90 Corridor from near Alberton to Clinton. As well as Highway 93 from Evaro Hill to Stevensville, and Highway 12 from Lolo to Lolo Pass. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds and rain changing quickly to snow as the front approaches, will create very low visibility and quickly changing road conditions. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Stevensville, Wye, Florence, Evaro, Bonner-West Riverside, East Missoula, Frenchtown, Potomac, Lolo Hot Springs, Clinton, Turah, Bell Crossing and Twin Creeks. This includes Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
